text: Hi Colleen, the team are looking into it at the moment, we're seeing that it might have something to do with mobile browsers but still investigating.

Anyone else noticing issues with custom fonts being loaded from external sources (typekit or <http://typography.com|typography.com>) via link tags - getting combined into the HubSpot combined css, causing it to break because the domain that is calling for the fonts is different than the site’s domain? On one site it’s causing a client to get really frustrated with us. I’ve added a bunch of HubSpot URLs to their approved domain list and it worked initially but now it’s broken again - oh and to make matters worse, the issue doesn’t affect everyone all at once - it appears to be affected by however HubSpot’s CDN works, people accessing the site near me get the same result, people a city over are likely closer to a different cdn server and are getting the problem.

Just wondering if anyone’s found a solution to this, because it’s really frustrating for both us and our client.
I believe <@U6TBZ66FN> fixed this previously?
in my case it wasn’t ever fixed - someone was going to work on it but we were sitting on my bandaid fix

which was to add <http://cdn2.HubSpot.com|cdn2.HubSpot.com> to the list of approved domains on <http://typography.com|typography.com>. 

It appears that’s not solidly working anymore as some people are not getting the fonts, some are
Looking …

<@U6TBZ66FN> Site experiencing issue:

<https://www.lamacchiagroup.com/>
Font loads fine with debug on:
<https://www.lamacchiagroup.com/?hs_debug_mode=true>
Screenshot of the correct font :
<https://spin.d.pr/fdpck2>
We have not sending the referrer from the verification service. If a page using that site’s css get combined css, that means the difference is < 1%. Can you share a URL?
Just saw the URL. Thanks. Checking.
My verification shows exact 3 of those diffs: 0.5% :slightly_smiling_face:
’Fraid you’re speaking over my head at the moment. what does that mean?
The full page pixel by pixel comparison: one 0.5% pixels are different with and without the combined css (that is the font from typography).
OHHHHH i getcha
theoretically <link> shouldn’t even get combined
Let me fix that by sending the referrers.
it’s third party hosted
I appreciate the help
We cannot skip some css, because it may override or be overridden, they must be in the order as they are in the page.
ahh, I guess that does make sense.

Just wanted to let you know that we found a temporary work around. We will use a multiple checkbox field but only give it one value. So if you are looking at our forms, they should now work with the new field but still don’t work with the single checkbox field.

<https://spin.d.pr/gR4aBa>

It strangely covers all of the other edit regions below it. (this happens both with and without the margin change)
just checking did you finish implementing this?
Sorry, not yet. Will be doing that next week.
Thank you for the update
